name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"e1b2d357-5e4d-44a5-b164-92219f8cfd1a","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":1,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group: Module Initialization & Imports","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bcc70fcc-8c37-458c-b433-8bfc49acd01d","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"These methods handle the high-level setup of the analysis. They process the file root and manage external dependencies, establishing the environment in which the rest of the code exists.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9ccf0622-ea0b-4aeb-8589-9d60ec241978","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"This group acts as the entry point for the static analyzer. Before diving into specific functions or logic, the processor must understand the "container" (the module itself) and its relationship to the outside world (imports). This ensures that when the analyzer encounters a variable later, it knows if it was defined locally or imported from elsewhere.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6c668c56-4341-46cc-9ca2-8044b65da432","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"f215cfd2-f2c4-4804-a494-f2e27fe9b7b4","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function Descriptions","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dd7edd15-fcf9-45fb-84f4-01e8c847741e","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Module","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5a1a2631-6f15-4337-a9df-6d3936929314","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Processes the root AST node for a Python module and initializes analysis for the entire file. It sets up module-level definitions, scopes, and call graph nodes, registers functions and classes found in the module, and prepares the module for further traversal and analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d4766383-bce6-4f6f-8d65-025ad3136b3e","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"19c6d8ce-a876-425c-8f77-92bf668f86f4","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Initialization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Creates a node in the Call Graph (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"cg","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") representing the module and updates the import manager.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"32cb6d96-251f-4928-a5ea-c5ead72f4248","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope & Definition Creation:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It ensures a root definition and scope exist for the module. It then pre-scans definitions found by the scope manager.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4b1e5d71-b061-42a2-ac4f-dc314a5b46ee","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Definition Iteration (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"iterate_mod_items","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Iterates over discovered module-level functions or classes and ensures each has a corresponding definition. It adds these definitions to the appropriate parent scope and registers classes with the class manager. This pre-scan is crucial because the scope manager and definition manager need synchronization before deep traversal begins.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"404ea592-cebe-4beb-b904-d9b09624f984","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_Import","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8d8fa813-8035-49ca-9be4-a777a0ecdc75","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Handles Python import statements encountered in the AST. It resolves module paths (including relative imports), triggers submodule analysis when needed, and updates scopes, definitions, and call graph edges to reflect imported symbols.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0c280211-e5e3-4446-911a-92a150c87e25","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f31ce9c6-bb1e-430b-b865-a5fbfb4838d3","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Name Resolution (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"handle_src_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Constructs the fully qualified source module name. It handles logic for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from X import Y","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by combining prefixes with imported names.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c6482e93-f1b2-4217-ba98-d2df5421da8a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Dependency Tracking:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It checks if the imported file is part of the project. If so, it may trigger a recursive analysis (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"analyze_submodule","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") of that file. It also adds edges to the call graph to represent the dependency.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ac4a589e-02a9-4dc5-b91b-c0fbb93183ba","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Scope Management (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"handle_scopes","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Manages how imported names appear in the current file.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"832bad66-6d5e-4893-9298-dd6d1dd86f1a","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If specific names are imported, it links the local name to the definition in the external module.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5ad4f085-9457-47f9-ac53-7351d80bd115","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If a wildcard (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"*","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") is used, it attempts to import all definitions from the target scope.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"761c27c9-290a-40c1-95ef-659541e20377","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"External Handling (","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"add_external_def","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If an import cannot be resolved (e.g., a standard library or missing third-party package), it registers it as an "External Definition." This ensures the analyzer doesn't crash on unknown names but tracks them as external references.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e8baaea9-b3e9-4e0f-86fc-b938a7adedbb","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"visit_ImportFrom","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"78c29b6d-d1e5-4f49-9bac-4d60612bcdd9","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Handles ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from ... import ...","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" statements in the AST.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a3d715c4-6bfe-48cf-8517-ee9a4c857707","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Internal Logic:
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"This is primarily a wrapper function. It delegates the actual import resolution to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visit_Import","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", but correctly extracts and passes the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" name (the "from" part) and the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"level","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (handling relative imports like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"from .. import","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to ensure consistency across both import styles.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8b66fcc8-5ccc-4b1f-a72c-b08e292faf34","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
